So what RJ. even if we all had your name, address, and telephone number, ho=
w can we get into your basement?=C2=A0 What do you think we are all coming =
over for a visit? lol sf
 

 



-----Original Message-----
From: Rj <ra=
sterer@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Mon, Jul 19, 2010 5:=
07 pm
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] An idea for RJ Experiment #3

          =C2=A0=
                                  I see what you're getting at there.=C2=A0=
 I'll have to see if I can come up with something like that without risking=
 'cheats' - for example, someone calling a friend in the area to go look.

=


--- On Mon, 7/19/10, trilobitegal <flexicalymenemeeki@...&g=
t; wrote:

From: trilobitegal <flexicalymenemeeki@...>
Sub=
ject: [EVP-ITC] An idea for RJ Experiment #3
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Da=
te: Monday, July 19, 2010, 11:11 AM

      =C2=A0                          =
   RJ, if you live in or near a large city, like Denver, how about writing =
a number in chalk on a public building where it won't be noticed right away=
, and can be erased easily after the contest?  That way, any spirits could =
locate the building, post, bridge, or whatever, and see if they can see the=
 chalk number or other symbol?  This might make it easier than trying to lo=
cate your home, with only an internet nickname to go by.  Just a thought.  =

 
 
      
              

              
      
                 
   
   =
    
  


----------MB_8CCF59F21416391_F84_3889_Webmail-d111.sysops.aol.com

<div>RJ, if you live in or near a large city, like =
Denver, how about writing a number in chalk on a public building where it w=
on't be noticed right away, and can be erased easily after the contest?  Th=
at way, any spirits could locate the building, post, bridge, or whatever, a=
nd see if they can see the chalk number or other symbol?  This might make i=
t easier than trying to locate your home, with only an internet nickname to=
 go by.  Just a thought.  <br>
 <br>
 </div>
